titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Warren D. Drumheller Paper, 1963
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections Ms1963-004

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The collection consists of a paper, "A Storage Analog Computer to Solve Polynormal Equations," which won "Best Student Paper" for the Region 3 competition of the Institute of Electrical Engineers, Inc., in 1963.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Warren D. Drumheller Paper must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Warren D. Drumheller Paper, 1963, Ms1963-004 - Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Warren D. Drumheller Paper was donated to Special Collections in 1963.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Warren D. Drumheller Paper commenced and was completed in 1963. Additional description was completed in April 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: William D. Drumheller was a student at VPI in the 1960s. He graduated in 1964. No other biographical information is available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a paper, "A Storage Analog Computer to Solve Polynormal Equations," which won "Best Student Paper" for Region 3-A competition of the Institute of Electrical Engineers, Inc. (IEEE), in 1963. Region 3 included the southeastern portion of the United States. The IEEE continues to sponsor student paper competitions.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by type of material.

relatedmaterial.p: VPI Drawing by William Drumheller (Art.351), Special Collections Art Collection.
